ratings.comment: Lisa Andrews is a phenomenal teacher. She is funny, kind, and caring. Her class is not too difficult, but you should probably go to the lecture and read the textbooks. I got an A because the tests were not hard. Overall, this course is great and easy. TAKE ANY CLASS LISA ANDREWS TEACHES. Seriously one of the best at UW-Madison.

Lisa is a wonderful professor and person. She takes the time to get to know all of her students. She is HILARIOUS! Her caring personality and sarcastic humor is contagious. If you ever have the chance to take a course taught by Lisa be prepared to have someone who genuinely wants to see you learn and succeed.
I love Lisa! I took her online CS 275 class and learned so much but got an A fairly easily. Take advantage of her extra credit options!

In class activities so go to lecture. Usually available outside of class, work on homework with people if you can. 3 exams, 2 projects (time consuming but simple). Her practice exams are VERY helpful in preparing for the actual ones. Nice professor who doesn't like lecturing too long. Funny, kind and relates career to class.
took this online, was a pretty fair class. Assignments open for 6 days, 3 main projects during the semester. Tests are similar to homework.

Lisa is FANTASTIC. The estate planning class I'm in with her is her first ever and she's easily my favorite professor I've ever had. She's a CFP who also owns her own firm, so she's extremely knowledgeable. She's more concerned with her students learning the material than giving over-the-top exams. Cares about her students and is very accessible!
